body: Success! I can build this from the command line. Now, we need to update the build instructions to suggest to install VS 2017 and the dotnet preview, but then only build from the command line. Or is this fixed in the preview of VS 2017 version 15.2? If so, we can suggest to use that instead.

Dear reviewer, please pay attention to the cases where I replaced calls to `Exceptions.Caught` and `Exceptions.CaughtAndThrow`, as those looked like code smells to me while editing. Maybe we want to file issues for them as part of this review.

I tested out the preview version 15.2 -- it shows the same behavior, so it looks like that feature is not available yet. I have updated the BUILD.md saying that building in VS2017 is not supported and that building has to be done at the command line.
@dougmsft, this could be an easy first one for you to merge.
I looked into the AppVeyor failure. It seems unrelated to the changes made here.

@markusweimer 
I added ParquetCollecton class as the result type of ParquetReader.Read. It's ready for review again.

@markusweimer 
Removed temp file during disposing. Simplified reader's construction. It's ready for review again.

Since we are deprecating VS2015, I added a check for a version of visual studio >= 15.0 and then switch to the 10.0.14393.0 SDK. It turns out there is also  10.0.15063 SDK available but I get errors when I try to compile with it.

I have tested both on a machine with VS 2015 / VS 2017 and just VS 2017. However, it would be nice to have some more testing.

I see test failures in IMRU, KMeans, and Group Broadcast Reduce in both VS 2017 and VS 2015. Are these known failures?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8461862/25417970/b06a5a90-2a37-11e7-9d5e-92c019507a97.png)

@dougmsft Looks like all tests on the screenshot are `...OnYarn` tests, which are known to be impossible to execute locally (you have to check the last one, for which the prefix is not visible in the screenshot). https://github.com/apache/reef/blob/master/lang/cs/BUILD.md has instructions on how to exclude `...OnYarn` tests from your local test runs to avoid scares like this :-)

AppVeyor failure seems to be caused by this change, both builds fail on the same test which is not one of our transiently failing ones:

    Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.Bridge.TestCloseTask.TestTaskWithNoCloseHandlerOnLocalRuntime

    Message "ExceptionCaught TaskCloseHandlerNotBoundException" expected to occur, but did not.
    Expected: True
    Actual:   False

    Error stack trace:

       at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.ReefFunctionalTest.ValidateMessageSuccessfullyLogged(IEnumerable`1 messages, String subfolder, String fileName, String testFolder, Int32 numberOfOccurrences) in C:\projects\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Functional\ReefFunctionalTest.cs:line 244
       at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.Bridge.TestCloseTask.TestTaskWithNoCloseHandlerOnLocalRuntime() in C:\projects\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Functional\Bridge\TestCloseTask.cs:line 107

Here is an example of a good build with all three builds passing: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/tcNickolas/reef/build/498-REEF-1788

However, I'm not sure whether build image for VS 2017 is the only thing installed on the machine, from documentation it looks like it is side by side with VS 2015.

And it raises time of each build from 1 hour to 1.5 hours
Well, it takes hours, if not days, for our tests to even start on AppVeyor.. I think 30 minutes difference is quite negligible in this context. I think I'll merge it.
I will commit this changes if there is no further comment.

Please don't :) Julia had left for vacation and did not publish all the
changes I've requested.

On Apr 27, 2017 1:58 PM, "Doug Service" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I will commit this changes if there is no further comment.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/reef/pull/1291#issuecomment-297837503>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAB6lKfiCztN-D_bzxy7sd85JUN7AitQks5r0QF3gaJpZM4M9S3l>
> .
>
Okay
Okay, I will try to do the commit.

Yes I knew they were Yarn tests so I did not think it was an issue, but just wanted to be sure. When run from the command line it appears the Yarn tests do not run. Is there a way to also setup visual studio to not run the Yarn tests by default? Do we have a section on the website that describes how to set up to run the tests on Yarn for REEF.NET as well as Java?

We could create a "local" playlist of tests and include only tests which should run locally into it. The problem is, any time we create new .NET tests we'd have to modify that file also. I couldn't find a way to run only tests without certain trait _by default_ in VS, but I'll be happy if it turns out there is such a way.

We don't have a way to run .NET tests on Yarn yet. This work was started in  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1541 but is not finished, someone needs to pick it up.
I feel "Powered by" header is confusing - is REEF powered by all these things? It should be either "Powered by REEF", "Related publications" or just "Other publications" is fine
@tcNickolas Thanks for your quick review! It's been fixed 😄
Rebased the branch.
I will test and merge
@markusweimer Can you look at and merge it? Thanks!
I will test this.
On my machine, that version of thSDK was not installed. Instead, I have version `10.0.15063.0`. Can we wildcard the SDK version to something like `10.0.*`?
Thanks, @tcNickolas, I am looking into that now.

LGTM except
1. fix test issue that is to look for some message
2. Can we merge other .Net related PL such as (REEF-1735) before this change to avoid merge conflict? As this change is more mechanical change and cross more classes.
OK, I think I am done with the fixes - @markusweimer please take a look.
I've decided to abandon this change in favor of one that *only* removes `Exceptions.throws` calls. The removal of the logging has too much potential to disrupt our current test infrastructure.
I'll merge this.
I merged this, but JIRA is down.

Other failing tests seem to be different, although I'm still a bit suspicious
I will take a look.
I have both 10.0.15063.0 and 10.0.14393.0 installed but only 10.0.14393.0 will build. Does 10.0.15063.0 build for you? What version of windows are you on? I am on Windows Server 2016.

OK, I think this is the minimal `pom.xml` I can produce to make both maven and IntelliJ happy.. @markusweimer please take a look
Thanks!
@markusweimer I have addressed your review comments. Thanks!
LGTM, will merge.

Try 'git clean -xdf' and then try restore and build. I have seen the same errors and that takes care of it.
Even after `git clean -xfd`, I still see the same behavior.

So I downloaded the same toolset and got the same results. This looks to be an issue with the dotnet tools as I can repro just from creating a test project by running the following:
 * dotnet new classlib
 * dotnet restore

I created an issue here:
https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/6619

I have posted a fix. 
The fix is to add the dotnet.myget nuget repository as this looks to have the latest version of the .net standard library (which is what is failing to restore). 

I have added this through a nuget.config file in the lang/cs directory. I'm looking to see if we can publish this in the csproj instead.

So with this fix you should be able to restore and build properly.
yes, this works. Will merge.
Travis failures indicate that one of the files fails rat check (missing license or license in incorrect format). Please run rat check locally and fix the failure.

Mater is already broken after REEF-1798 was merged. We should fix this rat issue before submitting new PL. I have a PL for it
https://github.com/apache/reef/pull/1309
If any one can review and merge, that would prevent all the following PLs fail at this step.

Let me try to understand the change. The whole thing is to have a separate csproj file for using different TargetFrameworks, right? Any other differences? Is it possible to write a build script to substitute the values in the existing csproj files and then build to avoid so many duplication?
Ah! Thank you for fixing this.
Verifying build for commit.

Hi Julia, 

Thank you for fixing the RAT issue!

Please take a look on the dev list for: 
Transition Proposal of .NET 4.5 Projects to .NET Core 

This talks about the project transition and the reasons why. Overall its a transition of projects. I did not want to disrupt the current .net development while adding these projects and therefore chose to have side-by-side projects. After migration is complete, the old projects will be deleted.

I am seeing a test error from Maven:

Results :

Failed tests:
  FailTaskTest.testFailTaskStop:86->failOn:52 expected:<FAILED> but was:<COMPLETED>

Tests run: 68, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 1
Those test failures are frequently seeing transit failures. The change is to add comments that should only impact build.

@singlis @markusweimer Please pay more attention to results of CI builds. We don't enforce that both builds must pass for a PR to be merged (it would be hard to implement given that we're merging PRs via Apache repository, not directly to Github). And I'm the first person to admit that our .NET builds are unstable :-) But a Travis build which fails all three build jobs must at least be considered when the decision about merging PR is made.
Whoops, sorry!

So this builds successfully, both locally and on the build server. Looking at the travis build, there are 4 tests that failed, however this check-in did not affect the tests as no source code was changed and the new projects are not part of the build.

@singlis Travis build passes. Do you mean AppVeyor? AppVeyor failures indeed don't look relevant to this change, they are caused by one test failing which has been failing for over two weeks now. I've opened an issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1804 to investigate the test failure.
This build passes, and `mvn validate` signs off. Merging.

If the condition `numTasks == total || numTasks == total - 1` doesn't hold, and the test fails again, we won't have a useful message to figure out what went wrong. Please add a message like "expected X or Y events, got Z"
The appveyor build failure is due to two versions of NewtonsoftJson being used. This does not appear locally and I will fix this on Monday. All of the C# tests pass locally.
Upgrading NewtonsoftJson is blocked by the 0.16 release. I will experiment with using and 8.0.2 and 8.0.3 version of NewtonsoftJson with .NET Standard 2.0 version of the Microsoft Avro library.
LGTM, will merge.

Reopening the request as the previous one was out of sync. I addressed all issues.
Shouldn't this have a JIRA associated with it?

Not necessarily. Some time ago, when we discussed moving build documentation to Github and the overheads of updating it after the move, we've agreed to skip the hassle of creating JIRAs for minor fixes which don't touch code and only modify the documentation. An example of such a commit would be d116d94e69f826d650d87d0d9e0dfdf0457502eb
Ok, I will commit.
LGTM, will merge.
@motus Node labeling is a long-awaited feature. Would you be interested in reviewing this PR for our GSoC student? We need help to test this PR in the production cluster. Thanks!

This expands REEF's `EvaluatorRequest` API for Node labels, right? Can you explain how node labels shall be supported or emulated on resource managers that don't support them?

I am asking because it is already possible to use YARN node labels on YARN via the interface `o.a.r.runtime.yarn.driver.YarnContainerRequestHandler`, which REEF Drivers can use in lieu of the `EvaluatorRequestor` interface, if they know they are on YARN.
